All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractDAO<T>
Abstract Class for data access operations.
BillCreator
BillCreator creates a txt file with the bill for an order.
Client
Client class defines a client.
ClientBLL
ClientBLL does operations on clients at business logic level.
ClientDAO
ClientDAO extends the AbstractDAO class and defines methods specifically for clients.
ClientView
ClientView creates the user interface for client operations, using java swing
ConnectionFactory
ConnectionFactory makes the connection to the database.
EmailValidator
Validates email address using regex.
Main
Main class - runs the application by creating a new object of class View and setting it visible.
Order
Order class defines an order by its fields: id, product, client and quantity.
OrderBLL
OrderBLL does operations on orders at business logic level.
OrderDAO
OrderDAO extends AbstractDAO and defines methods specifically for orders
OrderView
creates the user interface for orders using Java Swing
PhoneValidator
Validates phone number using regex and checks if it has between 5 and 10 digits.
PriceValidator
Checks that the price is positive.
Product
Product class defines a product by its attributes: id, name, stock and price.
ProductBLL
ProductBLL does operations on products at business logic level.
ProductDAO
ProductDAO extends AbstractDAO and defines methods for products.
ProductView
ProductView creates the user interface for operations on products.
QuantityValidator
Checks that the quantity is positive and that there's enough products in stock for the order.
StockValidator
Checks that stock is positive.
Validator<T>
Validator interface contains the validate method which will throw an exception if given data is invalid.
View
View class creates the main window of the application.
